title: krishnaverma
author: krishnaverma
content: Not asking to submit my profile there but to spend some spendable merits I have. I am less active here and I think my spendable merits will expire soon.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: You can start by reading through few post on the forum and you can discover and fined some quality post that you can spend your merit on, or better still you can visit the thread of most of the merit source and assist them by meriting a few members that need the merit. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5412657.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5465195.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5275032.0

comments.author: Liliana1304
comments.body: If you're willing to spend your sMerits, why not go to boards which are lacking these merit donors but have quality posters and become the Santa? No offense to the Op, but I doubt this is something to create a thread over because you can just be a Nicodemus about this and it's the recipient of the merit that would appreciate your act. This just looks like clout chasing and merit fishing to me..hey, it's just my two cents tho.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.created_time: September 13, 2023, 08:05:54 AMLast edit: September 13, 2023, 08:17:41 AM by EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on September 13, 2023, 06:50:53 AMNot asking to submit my profile there but to spend some spendable merits I have. I am less active here and I think my spendable merits will expire soon. In this case, you have to apply wisdom, don't just go and dump merits anyhow. I don't see a good reason to merit at other people's requested merit thread, do yours in your own way.If you are reading posts often, you will definitely see quality posts that fit your interests. By this, you can be meriting them regularly as they come your way. It's random that way and it's the best I would suggest. Also, going to sections like trading and speculation and other sections that are often under-merited might be a good idea that will make an impact too.Lastly, you might also want to open a new thread in the Beginners & Help section (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=39.0) to ask for people to submit their highest-quality posts. It might be 2 of their best posts each to be merited by you. It will be fresh in this case, benefit more accounts and will save you time as well.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on September 13, 2023, 06:50:53 AMI think my spendable merits will expire soon. Spendable merits do not expire, or at least there is no feature like that now.- Jay -

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Liliana1304 on September 13, 2023, 07:16:58 AMIf you're willing to spend your sMerits, why not go to boards which are lacking these merit donors but have quality posters and become the Santa? No offense to the Op, but I doubt this is something to create a thread over because you can just be a Nicodemus about this and it's the recipient of the merit that would appreciate your act. This just looks like clout chasing and merit fishing to me..hey, it's just my two cents tho.You're right. Many users place great importance on distributing their merits. I see this as very arrogant as if there are few topics and posts on the forum where you can reward someone without seeming to be doing a favor. When I see such topics, I always want to ask whether your posts for which someone gave you merit are so valuable, and whether are they better than all others?

comments.author: Liliana1304
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on September 13, 2023, 08:18:01 AMYou're right. Many users place great importance on distributing their merits. I see this as very arrogant as if there are few topics and posts on the forum where you can reward someone without seeming to be doing a favor. When I see such topics, I always want to ask whether your posts for which someone gave you merit are so valuable, and whether are they better than all others?You won't blame him, though. The next thing he'd go for is applying to be a merit source..  hehehe, that's me going too far, I know.Some of these guys feel they need to instate their importance and give themselves some form of credit as the forum is not giving them that. This act is not arrogant but a childish way to seek attention and I'm not annoyed, I'm just disappointed that he wasn't creative enough.

comments.author: Sexylizzy2813
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on September 13, 2023, 06:50:53 AMNot asking to submit my profile there but to spend some spendable merits I have. I am less active here and I think my spendable merits will expire soon. If your smerit will soon expire please can I know the expiring üòÅdate?You need not worry OP, just browse the Forum more and you'd see more qualified post to earn your smerits.Hold on OP, what's your point for opening this thread? Like we all know, Smerit is something you send out and not to keep it as one of your assets. Check other boards and you'd quality post to give.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on September 13, 2023, 06:50:53 AMNot asking to submit my profile there but to spend some spendable merits I have. I am less active here and I think my spendable merits will expire soon. Am sure are have not been that active well on the forum, if not you wouldn't have come here to be asking threads that do merit giveaway, do you actually needs a merit giveaway thread to disburse your smerits, there are boards enough with interesting threads you can just read up from bitcoin discussion board, economics or begginers and help to merit quality post there, also i don't know why you're so eager of letting go your smerits, are you going back to an inactive mode again or what.

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: Are you just planning to get affirmations from peeps in here?? Cus I'm sure you wouldn't come out so plain if you never had an idea there's actually a thread giving away merit... So tell me, how did you know that?? Huh? Why didn't you follow the same route to apply instead of creating an unnecessary post?!Anyways, talk a walk through the B&H and you'll see a couple of topics - fillipone, loyce,huge B and Ratimov are gladly running a review as long as you have a credible positing history.Sandra üßë‚Äçü¶∞

comments.author: letteredhub
comments.body: Quote from: Liliana1304 on September 13, 2023, 07:16:58 AMIf you're willing to spend your sMerits, why not go to boards which are lacking these merit donors but have quality posters and become the Santa? No offense to the Op, but I doubt this is something to create a thread over because you can just be a Nicodemus about this and it's the recipient of the merit that would appreciate your act. This just looks like clout chasing and merit fishing to me..hey, it's just my two cents tho.It's clear something wasn't right about op post. For Op I want to find out did those that spent their spendable merit's on him¬† made any post whatsoever before spending it on his posts they felt merit worthy?Op¬† should know that good intentions ain't broadcasts it is just rendered without pronouncement except there's a hidden motive behind your act.I just advise, when next you've S'merit to spend op should learn to do it nicodemusly¬† as @Liliana1304 opined, it's dignified doing it that way instead of publicizing it.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Just go to Beginners and Help where a forum member have a thread about submit your best post and get merit. You can just merit anyone who you deem fit to receive it just like this two threads [Merit] Help posts in local boards that did not receive enough merits and [Merit] Help newbies and those who have a little left to the next rank. Well, you can find more if you will look for it but I think that thread is enough to start in there. There are different forum members who posted there so you can choose who you want to sent it to. I thought it is all about asking where to get merits by submitting the profile link for review to get merits (aim=getting merits instead of giving smerits, title have other meaning if you think about it).

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: OP, despite the fact that you are not very active, as you said, but it's quite easy to distribute merit without creating this kind of thread. Already, you've gotten about 100+ merits from different boards, and you could as well scan through those threads and award some merit to whomever you think made a good effort on their post. As I even looked through the boards that you have mostly made comments on, I see that you have made comments on the India LB, and I think you can still go over to your local board (which is India) and award your Smerit to the quality posters on that board. Common Mahn, don't act like some hypocrite üë∫.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange on September 14, 2023, 11:47:36 PMOP, despite the fact that you are not very active, as you said, but it's quite easy to distribute merit without creating this kind of thread. Already, you've gotten about 100+ merits from different boards, and you could as well scan through those threads and award some merit to whomever you think made a good effort on their post. As I even looked through the boards that you have mostly made comments on, I see that you have made comments on the India LB, and I think you can still go over to your local board (which is India) and award your Smerit to the quality posters on that board. Common Mahn, don't act like some hypocrite üë∫. Good offer, although if you follow his activity in the Indian local section, you will see that he was last there in 2018. https://ninjastic.space/search?author=krishnaverma&board=89In addition, the OP is too narcissistic and once wanted to give away his merits, but in the end, he did not deign to bestow his favor on many. Quote from: krishnaverma on February 23, 2018, 05:38:41 AMChecked posts of all members who posted above and none qualify. Do not give up, keep trying. You will certainly improve if you have a positive attitude.but successfully assessed plagiarismQuote from: marlboroza on February 02, 2018, 11:45:36 PMWhy are you giving merit for plagiarism?And now he asks that we take his posts into account. I took the time to look at his profile, and I think either the OP is not the real owner or he has some serious memory lapses regarding the merit information. He, like no one else, explained all the subtleties of the topic louder than anyone else, but in the end, we see another stupid topic. Quote from: krishnaverma on September 13, 2023, 06:51:37 AMIs there a way to know how many spendable merits are going to expire soon ?¬† If not, it should be included in profile if possible. Quote from: krishnaverma on January 25, 2018, 09:53:47 AMQuote from: zenrol28 on January 25, 2018, 09:51:11 AMThe merit system got implemented like 10 hours ago. So expect different kinds of reactions. Either negative or positive, those reactions will add to the improvements of this system.We will see how it goes for the coming days.How about giving incentives to an active member who is always giving his / her sMerits to quality posts. Like +1 Merit for every 50 sMerits given. So a member will not only make quality posts, he / she will also read and give sMerits to those who deserve it.That will be very difficult to track for moderators. So far as giving Smerits is concerned, there is no point in storing the. It is mentioned that they may be nullified if not used for long term. Although not even the only one. Quote from: Sandra_hakeem on June 21, 2023, 09:53:51 PMQuote from: lovesmayfamilis on June 21, 2023, 08:33:14 AMPretty funny situation. After reading all the posts, I got the impression that the OP just decided to draw attention to himself, not at all thinking that people could easily check if the password was previously changed or not. Topic from the category "just to write something"But the situation now is that the OP has created even more fuss with his account, and people are demanding that he prove if the OP is the real owner or if the cheater is trying to protect himself from future claims.As a result, always think about what you write about; sometimes innocent stupidity can lead to serious consequences. Exactly!! The same thoughts was risen in me... the reasons?? I'm yet to know.Was that account an active account before the passcode got resetted? Cus I haven't been seeing that name around very often.Maybe OP didn't just wanna seek attention; he also wanted to make publicized the fact that his passcode has been changed, so peeps won't even bother using it against him when they get to realize that for themselves....so he decided to frame a fake story to convince the community beforehand - but, HTF is it even possible to deceive a whole community of gurus like this?...lolSo he finally came, on his own - without being interrogated - to report his ignorance on how passcodes are being managed.... I believe if that's the real owner behind the OP, then he shouldn't be creating lame stories like this.. now answer this; WHO TF HAS AN ACCESS TO YOUR BTT ACCOUNT AND YOUR EMAIL TOO TO HAVE CHANGED YOUR PASSCODE 2 GOOD TIMES BEFORE NOW ??Sandra üßë‚Äçü¶∞

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: You can easily check out the threads mentioned above or you can visit this thread [self-moderated] Report unmerited good posts to Merit Source where you can find some posts to merit and help them whom you find deserving.But your smerits don't expire over time keep in mind that.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on September 13, 2023, 06:50:53 AMNot asking to submit my profile there but to spend some spendable merits I have. I am less active here and I think my spendable merits will expire soon. From BPIP data, you've only earned just two merit in 150 days. I don't know why you're even worried about this. What's the essence of your topic. By the way, smerit don't expire. That's if at all you've enough to spend but you barely have any now.
